website_summaries.verdict: A comfortable dog harness that comes at a surprisingly low price.
pros: Soft and comfortable to wear, yet made to last
Features durable polyester and an adjustable chest belt
Priced to fit almost any dog owner's budget
cons: Might be snug on breeds with wide chests
Adjustment of the chest belt usually fixes this concern

customer_reviews.title: I like the harness
customer_reviews.text: I like the harness, as it is very soft and light. However, as mentioned by several users, it does run small. I have a Pug who is around 25-30 pounds, so I purchased the LARGE for her, and her head barely fits through the neck hole. There is still a little breathing room, so I will keep it, I just wanted to reiterate what others were cautioning about. I think it would be useful if people put their dog types/sizes in the reviews so people could cross-reference with their dogs.
customer_reviews.author: D. LaFleur

customer_reviews.title: Harness
customer_reviews.text: I read everything on the sight and came up with what size I would needed. Now I love the Harness But it's to big. I reached out to the seller to see about returning it or exchange it. They said it was not Eligible. Look up on amazon policy and it fits in the criteria. The harness is great just make sure your right or your stuck with it. This seller will not work with you This is the first time ever I have written a bad review..
customer_reviews.author: Alice R

customer_reviews.title: I measured my dog and ordered the appropriate size, ...
customer_reviews.text: I measured my dog and ordered the appropriate size, but it's way too small. I tried to get a return label, but the return postage would have left me only 65 cents, which isn't worth the drive to the post office. Nothing was actually wrong with the harness itself. The size chart and the return policy of the Puppia company were the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: 15 lbs Boston terrier size M
customer_reviews.text: My dog is small for her breed and was nervous that the size M harness was gonna be too big, however it fits perfectly. Afraid she may stretch out the neck from pulling while going on walks so we will see! Very comfortable feel. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: 80lb dog - XXL success!
customer_reviews.text: We have an 80lb lab who is arthritic with chronic cough problems. It was difficult finding a good harness for a dog her size, but the XXL fit the bill! I also love the purple color and think the price is great. I'm sharing a picture for those with larger dogs. As an FYI, she has lost a lot of weight and still has loose skin that in the pic might make it *look* like it's too tight, but I assure you it's a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy customer will not buy again, sizing is not consistent
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy, this is my second soft dog harness from Puppia. I measured my dog correctly. I happily opened the package and took the harness out and attempted to put it on my pup. The waist measurement would not buckle. I picked up the first harness and measured the new harness against it. The belly strap was much shorter. So I am stuck with a harness that will not work. I purposely looked up the first harness' name and ordered happily thinking this was a no brainer. I will not make the effort to ship this back, it is not worth the hassle. I am highly displeased at the 2 inch difference in the same size harness. Thanks. for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Edwards-Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Works well with some adjustments
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Well made harness, easy to put on and take off. Cons: The belt where the D ring is attached to moves too easily. When we walk the leash gets tangled around my dog and we have to stop to unravel it often. I "fixed" this by attaching a hairband to minimize the movement of the belt and added a ring for the leash. See the photo.
customer_reviews.author: QB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Lab puppy
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a soft/flexible harness for my lab puppy to wear all day long with comfort. For size reference: my labrador puppy is almost 5 months old (25 lbs) and I ordered size Large. It fits fine and she definitely has room to grow in every direction. She doesn't mind it and she looks adorable :)
customer_reviews.author: Courtneyyyy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn't pull forward, though he does stop occasionally and lean backward. When he does this the harness would bunch up around his neck. even if he started walking forward again it wouldn't lay right. I was constantly adjusting the harness during walks, pulling it back in place, having it lay flat again. Also, the fabric rubbed my dogs chest raw (see photo) and the buckle lay too close to his elbow joint (see photo) and chaffed him there. My dog is short legged, about 27lbs., long spine.
customer_reviews.author: Number20

customer_reviews.title: Best harness ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this harness for my 9 lb rat terrier. I purchased it because our other dog had one when we adopted her and it seemed like a nice harness. I was not disappointed! It is soft and comfy and super sturdy. The dogs can go all day in this harness and never have any issues like red spots, chafing, or hair loss like other collars and harnesses have given them. I wish that it was more greyish color like the picture shows but it is truly brown. However, it is still very nice and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G

customer_reviews.title: Love this harness for my lab pup!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like this harness because it fits well for my 7 week old Labrador puppy perfectly! I did some searches and came up with 10" collar for my first Puppia. It is working great! I didn't want her neck pulled on so the body harness has worked like I wanted it to work. I don't have to put a leg through it taking it on and off because it can go through a loop to link the strap over the back. I would buy this again if I get another puppy one day!!! I purchased the "Puppia Soft Dog Harness, Sky Blue, Medium"
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: This Harness Plastic Buckles Break Very Easily
customer_reviews.text: This product breaks very easily. I have two 20lb dogs that are certainly energetic but do not have the strength to break the plastic parts of this product. I feel it is due to the weak quality of the plastic buckles. I have purchased this exact product 6 times and they keep breaking. Why do I keep buying it? I will say the harness does fit the dogs well and they are very comfortable in them. So, whatever, I will pay the reasonable price so that my dogs have matching harnesses that are comfortable. But I know that the buckles will break easily and soon.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Escalona

customer_reviews.title: Neck too tighttoo loose
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this harness in the XL size for my pug. He was using L size of the same brand and the neck is too tight. Unfortunately when I finally got the harness, it was still too loose on my dog even with the Velcro fastened as tight as I could get it. I'm currently in the process of trying to return and exchange the item for a smaller size, but I'm still worried that the XS will be too tight on her oddly shaped body. Disappointed that it didn't fit right after reading such good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Great, but with a maybe-to-you significant flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased many. Looks great and seems comfortable on my dogs. Size always runs small, Well constructed. Not 5-star though as the "well-reflective", harness piping is cheaply glued on and wears/flakes-off shortly with daily use. The harness itself is rugged and lasts, I often walk my smaller dogs in the dark. I let them free-roam as I live out in the country. But I need to spotlight know their whereabouts because of coyote threats. When new, these reflective harnesses are the brightness around, Too bad they can't make these thing's reflective piping as durable. Now use these for showing off my dogs at visits to town as they're attractive.,
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Westerfield

customer_reviews.title: Problems.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this same harness a few years ago for my pup---same size, different color. It worked nicely and comfortably. The new one must have a different design, although visually I do not see it. On walks with my dog she began limping with her left front paw. I realized that her fur was getting caught up in the harness inside the upper part of her leg. Once I straightened it out, it would be fine briefly and then the problem recurred over and over again. I will be sending the harness back and looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: bcnewton50

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, washable
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand and style of harness for the past several years, with dogs of different sizes. Well-made, adjustable, and rich color. I have red, orange, navy, and sky blue. All have been washed (in a lingerie bag, gentle cycle) and have held up well without fading. I bought the medium to replace a size small, which did not adjust enough to easily snap around my dogs chest. The medium adjusts comfortably around his chest, but the neck of the harness is a little too large, so it is quite loose around his neck. I'm not sure it's going to work for him. He is a 6.5 lb long-haired chihuahua.
customer_reviews.author: Always me

customer_reviews.title: The harness looked super cute on our 10lbs Maltipoo
customer_reviews.text: The harness looked super cute on our 10lbs Maltipoo, but it was a bit too snug in the neck. By the chart, the large would swallow him. I also didn't like how high it sat on his neck. Maltipoos can suffer from collapsed Trachea with too much repeated pressure on neck, and I just didn't like how much pressure this harness was putting on his throat. I am sure it is a fit issue, with the small being too small and the medium being too large, but we have found other harnesses that are more adjustable and a better fit, and do not tug against the trachea like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: 05/15/19 - Ordered Large - it was MUCH smaller than previous IDENTICAL harness
customer_reviews.text: On the positive side, the company DID issue me a refund quickly and without fuss. On the negative, I held this up to my previous "Large" Puppia dog harness and I noticed the NEW harness looked like it was a good half-inch (or more) SMALLER. Had to take the time to pack it up and go over to UPS, and I do not have the TIME for that right now! SIZING IS OFF, BUYER BEWARE. I have a 32lb rescue girl, and this "Large" was TOO tight, too small. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Puppies soft mesh harness size small
customer_reviews.text: I think this harness has irregular sizing. I have always bought Puppia for my dogs and never had a problem. I now have 2, 5-6 lb chihuahuas. I had an old harness in size small that I tried on my new dogs. It was a little too large so I ordered two new extra Smalls. They would not even go over the dogs heads. I reordered 2 Smalls. They don't fit either. The strip of material that goes from the neck to the section that goes around the chest is too short. It seems like the ones I ordered are seconds. I have never had this problem with Puppia harness before.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best harness I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: First I want to say puppia brand products are quality products better than several other ones I've gotten and this particular one is one of the largest harnesses I could find for my Basset Hound matter of fact it was even too big but bassets grow for the first two years of their life in their chest widens out. He is now a year-and-a-half old weighs about 65 pounds and it's still big on him but not so much that he can't wear it and we know that he's going to fill it out in the upcoming year. This is honestly probably one of the best quality harnesses I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.author: bettina ringquist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent harness
customer_reviews.text: The harness is well made and fits well, altho I purchased the size larger than specified and am glad because they seem to run small. I have a mini cocker spaniel service dog and I purchased the large...his neck size is 14" and girth 22" and I think even a larger size would have been acceptable. But the large size fits well and it seems to be acceptable to my dog...when I get it out he gets excited to know he is going out as I live in an apartment on the 3rd floor and being elderly and disabled he doesn't always get out daily. Thanks Amazon for such great products and choices.
customer_reviews.author: Seniorlady

customer_reviews.title: Truly a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is crazy in traffic. We live in a concrete jungle at the moment. In the past she has backed out of her collar- that would be a death sentence here. We tried 2 other harness- Different brand-one too large, different model- one too small. While we liked the features of the puppia more recent model, this one worked best for her and was the right size. She has a big chest (her breed- Brussels Griffon) but this still fit great. Keeping her happy and safe keeps us sane and happy too. Great product and seems to be well made... so that is just doggie heaven for us.
customer_reviews.author: crowgirl follower

customer_reviews.title: It is strong, and easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: Love this harness. It is easy to put on and take off, works well when my dog suddenly pulls to chase a rabbit or squirrel. The only downside, and it isn't the fault of the harness, I have a chewer so I cannot leave the harness on her after a walk because she will chew it off. After warning my dog-sitter about this when I was out of town, I came home to find a chewed up harness...no matter, I just ordered another one, as I really really like this harness and it fits her well. It is not indestructible, however!
customer_reviews.author: Prof. P.

customer_reviews.title: A good fit!
customer_reviews.text: As a puppy, our Westie would chew stuff--out of boredom, perhaps...to relieve teething pain...or simply because she could. Before her first birthday she had chewed her way through several harnesses. Maybe they were uncomfortable; I don't know (one canine expert likened the discomfort of wearing a harness to tolerating a girdle--yikes). In any case, the Puppia brand has always seemed to escape Fiona's chewing. We now own pink, red and magenta ones, and I will continue to buy them because they hold up well, launder well (air-dry, please) and this pink one still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stylish!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this harness for about a year now on my short, 30lb Beagle. He has a deep chest, so the fit isn't perfect (a little snug around the chest and a little loose around the neck) but it works well. We go on lots of hikes, sometimes all day through mud, water, and scrambling up rocks. This harness has seen it all and we've had no issues! I love the color options too.
customer_reviews.author: JD Mesh

customer_reviews.title: works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect to like the change from the old-fashioned "Roman harness" to this one and I was quite sure my dog would be less than thrilled. Wrong on both counts! As soon as she had it on, Sue was happy with it. My only qualms were that it was a soft pink, which didn't match her hot-pink leash (Sue couldn't have cared less) and that I have a bit of trouble unfastening it sometimes after a walk. The color problem was resolved when Amazon dropped a line asking if I didn't want to buy one in neon pink. I did. The latter is just a matter of getting used to the buckles.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Love Puppia, One of The Best Harnesses !!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg I love this Puppia Harness so much !!! I walk dogs for a living & fell in love with this harness, it’s so secure & good for the summer! I love it’s Mesh material which helps it to be more breathable & comfortable ! Max is 13lbs & Louie is 10lbs & I got them a size Medium. Now the size Medium fits Max great, however I think for Louie it’s a little big. There’s definitely some space not a big space but I would prefer a little smaller for his size just to be safe ! But I still love this harness & is so glad that I bought it, definitely worth it ✔️
customer_reviews.author: Keyona McLean

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but they do run small.
customer_reviews.text: Was super cute! I should have read the reviews before. They do run small. I had gotten a small for my 7.8 lb chiweenie and it was so thight I could fit it over her head. So if you're thinking you need a small better get a medium. Otherwise it's super cute and sturdy. I don't know why some say it's very difficult to return. I just went to my order and picked the harness order and followed Amazon's instructions. Though it cost me $5.99 to return it to a Amazon's drop location which are lockers. Took me about 10 minutes there and 10 back to the house.
customer_reviews.author: M lou

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This harness is perfect. It fit my cat perfectly and is also very comfortable. My cat is 9 months, weighs between 8-9 lbs and wears a size XS in the light blue color. He's a flame point Siamese.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: XXL is a perfect fit for my medium sized dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog is about 60 lbs with a 19" neck and a 30" girth, muscular and compact - a medium sized dog with a blocky head (looks like pit bull/boxer mix.) His back is level with my knee and I'm 5'4", so not a big dog at all. I was afraid this wouldn't slip over his head, but it was fine and fit perfectly without any adjustments. I wanted something he can be comfortable wearing around the house and lying down in while we're doing a lot of training throughout the day rather than something to only wear on walks. Nice color selection.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic

customer_reviews.title: difficult proportions + no returns!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this before I saw that there was a no-returns policy. I was hoping it'd be a good fit for my cocker spaniel because of the soft mesh, but the proportions of the harness were completely off and I can tell a size change still wouldn't have done the trick. I went to process my return and realized that for whatever reason this harness can't be returned, which is disappointing. I see these harnesses on smaller dogs all the time so I know they're great for certain breeds, but I'm overall disappointed with the outcome of the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable easy-on, easy-off harness
customer_reviews.text: The Puppia brand cannot be beaten when it comes to high-quality dog harnesses. We have an aggressive walker and traditional harnesses would leave her belly agitated and scratched - not at all the issue with this soft and comfy harness. It’s also incredibly easy to get on and off. Wish we would have went with Puppia from the start!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I wanted something that would help me control her but not dig into the soft skin under her front arms like some harnesses do
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a 50 LB (she's overweight...we're working on it) sheepdog who is very enthusiastic and tugs when she walks. I wanted something that would help me control her but not dig into the soft skin under her front arms like some harnesses do. I measured her and ordered what I thought was the right size but it was a snug fit around her neck. What's more is the material seemed sort of flimsy, I don't think it would hold if she pulled. I think this would work fine for a smaller dog, like under 30lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Eevee

customer_reviews.title: Cute Harness, Smaller Than Advertised, FANTASTIC Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Cute, but harness was too small - I measured my cat beforehand, she has a little under 8" neck and a 12" girth (~9 lb cat), so this should have fit her, but it didn't, even when adjusted to maximum size. If you're ordering for your cat, you probably want at least a size Small for a small to medium sized cat. I'm VERY satisfied with my customer service experience, though. I started a return for it, and Amazon/Puppia Int'l Inc. is refunding me AND letting me keep the harness. I'll probably donate it to an animal shelter, or to a friend with a cat. They went above and beyond and I really appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good harness for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 95 lb dog perfectly! I had to buy this because he has a sore on his chest, and there was no good way to keep bandages on it. This harness is perfect to make sure his bandages stay in place. My only complaint is that the strap that goes around the belly is very loose through the strap the the leash attaches to. Because of this, when I take him for a walk in the harness, he often pulls it pretty far to one side, which is pretty annoying. Other than that, it's soft, and he seems to enjoy wearing it!
customer_reviews.author: AndreaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Harness!!! A++++
customer_reviews.text: We adopted our puggle, Doug, in 2017 and this was the first thing we bought for him. We've had the harness for him for almost TWO YEARS now and it's still in great shape! I would note though, that if not careful, dog can slip through the harness if pulled in the wrong direction, over the head. But I would definitely recommend this harness! (It would be best for a laid back type dog and not a puller like my husky/collie mix Hank lol!)
customer_reviews.author: naomi

customer_reviews.title: This is a great harness. I had to order two for my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great harness. I had to order two for my pug because I got the wrong size the first time, but I just ended up keeping them both (he was only 8 months at the time, so he's grown into the large one some but it still doesn't completely fit). So, be careful with the sizing. Other than that, I think that this is a very nice harness. It's got a fairly easy on/off, and it seems to be pretty comfortable, especially for running around. He wears this harness to the dog park and runs with the other dogs. He's been wearing his harness almost daily now for about 2 months, and it is holding up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Appy

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made harness but weirdly sized/designed...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice harness, but it's very difficult to get over the head of any dog because the neck opening is so comparatively small. The chest harness is very adjustable, but the harness seems to be designed for a (1) a dog with no ears and (2) a dog with a very skinny neck and even smaller head. Don't worry though -- the chest and belly of the dog can pretty much be huge. I don't know what animal this is designed to fit, but I don't think it's a dog.
customer_reviews.author: C. PilotTop Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: I like it for my cat but he knows how to slip out
customer_reviews.text: Used for our cat to get him outside without running away. Works great except if he starts pulling away backwards it slips off. With that in mind he never slips it now. Unfortunately that means I can't turn him to a post outside to sit with us because he knows how to slip it. Great for when your keeping a close eye though so I certainly would recommend it. Better for your cats well being to have something that wraps the body rather than the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Bran hanson

customer_reviews.title: There is no neck adjustment- had to throw away
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a new 3.5 pound puppy. I thought I was ordering ipuppyone brand that adjusts at the neck. I googled ipuppyone and got puppia without noticing they were different. Don't make my mistake. You need that neck adjustment feature that puppia did not have. I could not get the extra small size over the head of a 3.5 pound puppy. the problem was, I had already mongramed it with the puppy name so I had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: luv2shop

customer_reviews.title: Dog harness straps are of poor quality and lack the strength of a more robust ...
customer_reviews.text: Dog harness straps are of poor quality and lack the strength of a more robust nylon based strap. A small cut or defect on the strap causes, through multiple use, a tear that renders the strap useless and unable to restrain the dog in the event of an accident. Although the harness is comfortable enough for the dog, the poor quality straps are a detriment for a reliable safety restraint if the car suddenly came to a stop.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Oka

customer_reviews.title: Crazy sizing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the medium harness and it was way too big for my dachshund. I have the same style harness from a different company for my last doxie - which was a large. My new girl is smaller so I ordered the medium. I'd also read the other reviewed that said the sizes are all over the map. The medium was the exact same size as the large from the other company, so returned it and ordered the small. The small is tiny! It would never fit over her head and she's got a small head. So, that's it for Puppia I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Finally - a harness that she likes.
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to get a harness for my Yorkie that she would leave on. She hated all the ones I tried and even chewed them off. This one she actually likes. I know this because she actually holds still while I put it on her after her bath. I leave it on her all the time to help catch the "speeding" puppy as she tries to evade me. lol. She is a ball of fire. This will not choke her when i try to teach her to walk on a leash. I recomene this brand highly.
customer_reviews.author: mare36

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For My Pom
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect on my little Pomeranian. It still chokes him if he pulls on the leash but it's still worlds better than just a simple leash that goes around the neck. Note to other dog owners: Please use a harness with your leash and not a collar with your leash - especially on toy breeds. A collar can constrict a little dog's neck so much that their trachea can be permanently damaged (collapsed) and they can die.
customer_reviews.author: drguerrant

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have a standard poodle, and this size fit her well! I measured her, as I would suggest you do as well. It's incredibly easy to understand how to put on. I did have to loosen it quite a bit when I first put it on her, but that's hardly a big deal. There's some room to spare as well. She seems comfortable, and it came very quickly, which was useful as she'd broken her custom collar.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: I measured my dog as it says to do. I ordered the small thinking that should fit her. It does not. It runs small in my opinion. I love what I see and returning the small and ordered the medium. I love the material and how it feels. Can't wait to get the medium! I gave it 4 stars only because I feel it is not true to size and runs small. When I get the medium I will do another review of my thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Sue V.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for our pug
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the large for our 21 lb pug and it was a perfect fit. This seems to be much more comfortable than the strappy kind of harness we were using. Our pug will sleep in it and she doesn't wiggle out of it and get tangled. I did a lot of research to find a harness that would fit the wide neck of a pug and everyone referred to the Puppia. It seems crazy to order a large for such a small dog, but the neck fit and the waist adjusted down to the fit we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Samie May

customer_reviews.title: who ya gonna call?
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and its easy of use.. I purchased the puppia dog harness on Oct 31, 2019. After a little more than 2 months I had a problem with the clip, it broke. I was surprised because that style clip is used on many different things. I thought it was strange for the clip to break. Stranger yet I could not find a way to access a return. So I decided to write about the expierence.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Falzone

customer_reviews.title: Size is true to the size chart
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my little guy! He is a small dog but his measurements were for the medium size. I got the medium size and it fits him perfect. I am more than pleased with this product size wise. It's only been 1 day so I'm not sure the quality, but it doesn't seem cheaply made it feels sturdy. I got the camo design and looks great on him too! ***update*** I had to buy another one due to my little one chewing on the clip part. Had it for a couples weeks and he found it and chewed it up lol he did not ingest any prices, but was such a good product I repurchased it
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Leonardich

customer_reviews.title: Difference between size medium and large is HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: We love Puppia's harnesses SO much...they are easy to put on and are so comfortable for our dog. We have bought one in almost every size as our puppy had grown. BUT...there's a huuuuuuge discrepancy between the size medium and the large! Our pup grew out of the medium, so we naturally bought the next size up. The large does not fit him at all. The neck is quite loose, but if we could adjust the body strap tighter, we could make it work...but the body strap doesn't adjust small enough. We've used it a few times just out of urgency, so I can't return it, but in the process of looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: CookShopEat

customer_reviews.title: Great harness for those that can read a size chart
customer_reviews.text: Love this style of puppia harness. Lightweight, comfortable, holds up well. People complaining about sizing just don’t read the size chart (*eye roll*). If you measure your dog and order according to the provided size chart, it will fit. Keep in mind the measurements on the size chart are the measurements of the HARNESS, not your dog. Whatever the chart lists as neck size is the size of the HARNESS’S neck opening. If you have a dog with a thin neck but big head, don’t expect the harness to fit over based on your DOG’S neck measurement. Measure the widest point of your dog’s head. My slender 8.5lb Maltipoo wears a size small and it fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Get Medium instead of Small
customer_reviews.text: I got a small because I was looking at other peoples photos of their cats on their reviews who had purchased small and it look like it would fit my cat but when the small came I couldn’t even fit my cat into it. It was way too small. So I think I’m gonna have to order a medium for my fur baby. But the material that they use for it is excellent you can see that it’s strong and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate sizing!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I need this trainer harness for my golden pup right now but can’t use it. Measurements are inaccurate and way too large! I ordered a Large, 14.5” per the chart for neck, but it measured 16”! The breast girth is minimum 21” not 20” and cannot be tightened further. And the stitching in the black neck band is not stretchable at all. Maybe 1/4” at the neck at the very very most. I’m returning this because I can’t trust the smaller size will be accurate. I trusted the numerous reviews and wanted to like this harness but so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Steve

customer_reviews.title: Harnessing the power
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy is growing at an alarming rate and we needed something to help keep her safe on our walks as she has tracheal collapse and can only use soft harnesses. This is by far the best harness. It sits perfectly on the chest and shoulders, giving relief to her neck if she does pull. It also has been growing with her which is great. This is my second puppia harness. I had previously bought a similar one years before for my other dog and loved it so much I got another. Great harness.
customer_reviews.author: Jenae

customer_reviews.title: My dog is super active and can be a nightmare to walk
customer_reviews.text: My dog is super active and can be a nightmare to walk. She's only 25 pounds but she's stronger than her weight would indicate, and she pulls the leash like crazy. She had an Easy Walk harness before, but it chafed her underarms and didn't seem to help much with the pulling. I got this harness because it's really cute and I've seen it on lots of other dogs (yes, I'm that person). It has done wonders. My dog is so much better at walking calmly with this harness, and I can control her much more easily. Plus she looks super cute. As others have noted, sizing is kind of weird. My 25-pound Australian Shepherd mix wears a large.
customer_reviews.author: BethanyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My girl and I love this harness!
customer_reviews.text: My girl is a yorkie mix weighs 13 lbs and has a 12 inch neck and her chest is 18 inches. Medium fits her perfectly. The neck isnt too large and the chest is adjustable. I can't say enough good things about this harness. It's affordable, well made and very soft. The edges are lined in a felt type material so it seems comfortable for her too. Zero complaints and I'll be buying more in different colors!
customer_reviews.author: NJHS

customer_reviews.title: Cat slipped out of it very first time out.
customer_reviews.text: Our first time out the cat slipped right out of it. I measured his girth and neck and settled on small. Was going to send it back but there was no option of "did not fit". I think they should explain how to size your animal better. What I discovered is that there is lots of room to make the girth bigger so I should have gone with x-small. But the neck was on the small side and doesn't adjust and my cat is still growing. I am going to go ahead and keep it and alter it myself. It is nice looking and looks well made. Once I alter it myself I think it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: brenda vincent

customer_reviews.title: Overall Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this harness. I had to send the first one back as I found the measurements inaccurate but got the right size & so far so good. In my opinion The cost of harnesses in general seem a bit costly In my opinion. With that said the ones at the pet store were at least 10$ + more but also seemed a bit thicker. I personally like this one because it’s light weight. Love the color too.
customer_reviews.author: Bravo

customer_reviews.title: I hate this thing!
customer_reviews.text: .... and my dog does too! Bought for my teacup poodle puppy who was just learning to.walk on leash. Getting this thing on/off is a major pain and about pulls his eye lids off because the neck is so snug! Once it is on, it is secure and q.good harness, but it isn't convenient at all. Will buy another harness because I can't take this one anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Renee Williams

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a nice harness but sizing is way off.
customer_reviews.text: Got the XL size for my Boston Terrier based on the size chart but it was huge when we tried it on. The neck hole does not adjust and is 18”. The smallest size the chest strap gets is 22.5”. Was trying this because we liked the Gooby X soft harness but they would come unstitched or rip on the chest, this is the same material but one piece (no seam on the chest).
customer_reviews.author: S. Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Fits easily
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a harness for our young dog because he pulls on the leash so much. We tried out quite a few and all of them were either too complicated to put on our too bulky or had a bad fit. This one fit the bill: Easy to put on, fits perfectly and is nice and lightweight so that the dog can even wade into the water with it. Dries in minutes and does not rub the dog anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Excellent harness for small breeds.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent harness for a small breed. Very secure, very comfortable and takes strain off of delicate little tracheas. Our little guy is chewing through everything so we had to buy new ones. Would be good to have a different, tougher material on the upper edge of the breast part. Still, we’ll keep buying these because of excellent protection.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Feblowitz

customer_reviews.title: ) it's like trying to bathe a CAT
customer_reviews.text: It's a little difficult to put on and my wiggly little buddy is usually SO excited when he sees me get it out (he LOVES going walking!!) it's like trying to bathe a CAT!! Other than that, it fits well and does what I wanted it to do (keeps him from CHOKING when he pulls hard on the leash because it distributes the area of restraint). I just wish it were a little easier to "dress him" for his daily outings.
customer_reviews.author: K. Carsey

customer_reviews.title: Great for looks only
customer_reviews.text: Great design, it's a beautiful looking harness but it has a really lousy location for the latch. My pomchi mix(he's very small) was able to bite through it in a matter of moments. I think if the latch is placed in a different location(on the backside like most other harnesses) it will be perfect. Otherwise the latch being on the front is just a beck and call for a doggo to gnaw/chew it. The material was surprisingly not sturdy. I had to return the harness but the Puppia company was gracious enough to refund my money. I hope they redesign the harness with this kind of situation in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Lila Miles

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: The harness itself is very well made; sturdy stitching, light fabric and breathable. The material is very soft and malleable, so stiffness shouldn't be an issue. I unfortunately had to return the one I ordered, because it's too large. According to the chart it should fit, but the harness is just a tad too big - and by the way, I wanted to use this on my cat. He managed to slide one paw out through the neck portion, which isn't good. The next smaller size is way too small though, compared to the size M I ordered. So, even though I really like the make of this harness, I cannot use it .
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: 14 pound Boston Terrier puppy/ small harness
customer_reviews.text: I got the yellow puppia harness for my Boston when he weighed 10 pounds and the small fit great. Since then he has gained 4 pounds and its time to upgrade! I will be purchasing the size medium camo harness. The quality was pretty good for the price. I have had the harness for about 2 months now and the only compliant in quality was a few strings from the yellow fabric started to stick out and had to be cut. The yellow color gets dirty quickly which is really no fault of the manufacturer. Overall good quality especially only having spent less then 15 dollars
customer_reviews.author: Winston’s mom

customer_reviews.title: Sizing off, why even bother. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is growing fast. She’s 7months, 4.2lbs and I followed the chart and it still was way too big on her. The whole thing was moving on her when I attached the leash, and she simply wouldn’t walk. Walking outside is her favorite thing ever and I was sad to ruin that for her with this product. Sent it back. I would not order again.
customer_reviews.author: A Fair Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great harness, inconsistent sizing
customer_reviews.text: Love these harnesses for our four legged children. Soft, enough 'give' to let pups move comfortably in them without rubbing under their legs. We've had dogs of every size, and each has worn them. We've experienced a size issue a couple times with our largest dogs, and our fault entirely that we didn't try them and return in time. Be sure to check for good fit as soon as you receive. Otherwise, best option we've found. Our German Shepherd loves to swim, and harness holds up really well.
customer_reviews.author: n.c.reader

customer_reviews.title: Your dog will thank you!
customer_reviews.text: this is the 1st harness i've bought for any of my dogs thru the years. I recently got a rescue terrier mix and he would pull so hard he'd start choking when i took him for a walk. I decided to try a harness and the little guy loves it ... he knows how to stick his head and leg thru and starts dancing around when he sees me with it. Now he automatically stops at the road crossing to the park instead of pulling and choking when i used a collar.
customer_reviews.author: fatcatdeals

customer_reviews.title: Best there is. Especially for small to midsize dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth Puppia harness I have purchased. One as a gift, three for my dogs. They are extremely well made, soft, therefor the dogs are comfortable wearing them for even an extended period of time. Even after 6 years for one of them, it looks great. Every now and then, I throw them in a pillow case and wash them in the machine at low temp, and they come out like new. The cheaper nylon harnesses are just not as well made, and it's often easier for the dog to slip out, or when too tight they can leave rashes. It's better to invest in one of these ....wait for it......Puppias ;)
customer_reviews.author: Alanis Smithee

customer_reviews.title: Belly friendly- No more napping on buckles
customer_reviews.text: We tried so many different harnesses for our pooch and they all had the same issue- lots of bumps and buckles on the belly side. This one doesn’t and it looks quite cute, too! My dog doesn’t mind wearing it for extended periods even to lounge in. With other harnesses he is tossing and turning to find a non-buckled spot or stares at me to take it off.
customer_reviews.author: NYCflower

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: When we adopt my dog, he came with one exactly like this. It got old after few years. We purchased several ones and gave them away or toss them because they were not practical or the material was not as soft as this one. I dont know why I did not look in Amazon before but I am so glad I did now. I ordered and arrive within 2 days. My dog looks so cute in it. Perfect size, bright color. great price.
customer_reviews.author: Lola de Leo

customer_reviews.title: Sizing chart is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The harness seems well made, but the size chart is not accurate. My 6-month old dachshund could barely fit her head through the neck opening. It was too tight for her even though I had already "sized up" from what the sizing chart indicated. The company does not accept returns. Amazon made things right, but I won't be ordering a harness from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: elkwrestler

customer_reviews.title: Order larger size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the medium size going of size charts. Wrong I have 2 dogs 20lbs and 30 lbs not fat and reordered in large size perfect fit. Several years ago ordered med size great fit but the medium sizes I got were too small . Not a big deal seeing how reasonable the price is. Would recommend going up a size over what chart indicates.
customer_reviews.author: Dudley Eppes

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that fits my tiny chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: This is the only harness (XS) I could find that fits my 3 lb teacup chihuahua. It's adjustable so she can be comfortable. The metal hook works perfectly with her leash and with her jacket on cold days. Pretty well-made, stands up to gentle washing really well. I have one in black and one in camouflage, both are adorable on my dog.
customer_reviews.author: cchayoo

customer_reviews.title: Very nice blue color
customer_reviews.text: Very nice blue color. The XL fits my 50lb golden retriever perfectly. I was concerned because her neck size measured 16-17 inches but it goes over her head perfectly. Update - I have used this for 2 weeks now and the sewing on one of the seams is starting to unravel. This harness does not seem to be made as well as other similar harnesses I have used. If you have a small dog I recommend the Oxgord. I bought her the XL Oxgord when she was a 25lb puppy and it held up really well. However, they don't make harnesses for larger breeds, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: PKelly

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable looking and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: We tried another harness with extra buckles and handles but it was too bulky and did not fit well. This is a lot more lightweight, breathable, and forming to our dog. Since he likes it more, I will say he probably pulls harder than the other harness that had a clip on the front as well as the back, but that's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Fits comfortably for my new pup
customer_reviews.text: With past harnesses, it takes a bit of time for a new pup to get used to the strange contraption being tied about their body. They seem to reluctantly pull away and stubbornly lay about instead of walking comfortably. My pup acted as if the harness wasn't even there! It was his first time with any sort of harness training, and he seemed super comfortable, walking without any awkward trot and performing tricks without feeling distracted by his new vest. I bought the medium, so he could grow into it a bit, but even being so loose he hasn't tried to wrestle out of it. Will definitely buy again once my GSD grows up and needs the larger sizes.
customer_reviews.author: James and Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small, even for maltipoo
customer_reviews.text: Purchased small for 10lb maltipoo and it was too small his chest girth is right in the middle of the range for size small but was too tight and short from neck to shoulder. Wanted to exchange for medium but only option was to return for now. Nice harness, seems more comfy than strap harnesses and quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these (for each dog), and love them. They go on so easy and don't bother my dogs at all, though if you pull when they are behind you it does bunch up a bit. I have a pug and a collar never worked for her since it would just pull right over her head. This is by far the best harness I've ever used, and we've tried many.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Schiro

customer_reviews.title: Great for our Frenchie 💚
customer_reviews.text: The green color is really bright, which I love! Something to consider when buying - the clasp is plastic. My frenchie got a hold of it when he wasn’t wearing it and chewed the clasp for about 5 seconds before we grabbed it and it was enough to crack it. Our fault but be careful 🙂 the fit is adjustable which has been nice as our pup has gained a few pounds with the colder temps. We purchased the camo color a while back and the fabric frayed and pilled - haven’t noticed that with the green one.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and soft but not for super tiny dog.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and soft but was too big for my tiny dog. I purchased the xsmall for my six year old micro yorkie. She weighs 2.3 pounds but I was hoping the xsmall would be adjustable enough to fit her based on measurements. The item itself is super cute and seems well made but neck does not adjust at all so my dog got out of it in 30 seconds. I will be donating the one I bought since it won’t be worth paying return shipping. I wish they made an xxsmall. Very cute harness.
customer_reviews.author: BellaBean

customer_reviews.title: but I didn't like needing to constantly monitor and adjust the rubber stopper ...
customer_reviews.text: The small is a fraction too big for my 8lb kitten, but he's rapidly growing into it. He was harness trained with the S and M sizes of the "come with me kitty" harness, but I didn't like needing to constantly monitor and adjust the rubber stopper on his old harness. This one is so much cuter! He has never made a wholehearted attempt at escaping from any harness, so I can't vouch for how escape-proof this one is. Since the neck is a fixed size that you slip the head through to put it on, I wouldn't risk it with any known escape artists.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Hardwicke

customer_reviews.title: Way too small-very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a small for my 2 month old Queensland Heeler Puppy and my daughters put it on her. It looked way too tight and when I tried to take it off of her it wouldn't come off. There wasn't an adjustment to loosen it and I had to cut it off as it was causing her discomfort. Very disappointed in how small this item was and that I had to cut it off and am now out the money. Wouldn't recommend at all as there is no way to adjust the neck tightness.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great, Affordable Little Harness!
customer_reviews.text: This harness is excellent, and I no longer have to worry that my puppy will try to play tug-of-war with his leash or pull so hard he'll choke himself. We got a matching leash and it's a great, durable product. The only issue I have is with sizes, we bought both small and medium but for a while medium was too big and small irritated him. Lucky for us we saw people putting the harness over dog sweaters and jackets so now the medium is perfect. Oh and I really do wish puppia had matching collars because none of the ones I bought matched completely.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Runs just a tad small. Dog uncomfortable but easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Not crazy about the way it looks. Dog a bit annoyed by this but he isn't used to a full harness. Bought becuase measurements were provided rather than simply weight. If your g dog is in the upper range of the size, I'd go up a size. Elderly mom needs something very easy to attach to leash and this accomplishes that. Dog would be more comfortable in something strappier than this and it's sort of ugly but pretty well made. Hopefully the dog will get used to it and be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Gilligan

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Ordered yellow for my Maltese Poodle. Very well made harness. Unfortunately, due to stay at home, my dog is full with fur and harness is JUST fitting. I ordered the medium- which goes up to 22" chest, his chest is 21". If he had a haircut, it'd give him more space. Is true to size, I'd order again.
customer_reviews.author: Artsy Girl

customer_reviews.title: snap failure, due to puppies having teeth.
customer_reviews.text: 4 month old beagle chewed and broke the connecting snap on the medium size harness within days (~4) of first use. She outgrew the small size which has a slightly smaller snap but made of thicker plastic. The medium size harness has a snap thickness of ~1.15 mm and the small size has a thickness of ~1.91 mm. The snap on the new medium size just did not work. This does not look like a manufacturing defect but rather a DESIGN FAILURE. If your dog has teeth and knows how to use them do not buy the medium size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size Chart
customer_reviews.text: The only reason it doesn't get a five is because the sizing chart is inaccurate. I followed the measurements and used a fabric tape measure around the chest and neck; ordered the medium accordingly. The harness was so large my Pomeranian could pull his leg out. He eventually got completely out and chewed the harness to pieces. Not only did I have to order a new harness but he could have hurt himself. Other than sizing; the product is strong but soft. Seems very comfortable. Works well with a very hairy Pom. I did purchase a small and will update my review when that one arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Peach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect harness for our Dachsunds, and last a long time!
customer_reviews.text: Love these harnesses for our two Dachshunds! They provide excellent control without adding stress to their backs or necks. Much harder (but not impossible) to slip out of compared to the mesh vest by Puppia. I highly recommend these harnesses. Our mini Dachshund and standard Dachshund both wear size Medium.
customer_reviews.author: MHM42

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 27-30lb frenchie perfectly. Fibers show though
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 32 lb frenchie perfectly in the XL size. Still has room for growth. Ive purchased three of these in the past which have lasted a while, this time i ordered the camo one and the fibers started coming out as if it was washed several times, even though it wasn’t. Amazon will not send me a new one prior to returning this one and its the only one I have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Gisselle

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this after reading that neck harnesses can cause damage to a dogs trachea. You purchase this for our dog and it really is easy to put on and takeoff. The only issue is that one size up is too big for her neck and one size down is almost a little too tight but overall it is a great homeless.
customer_reviews.author: Telsa

customer_reviews.title: Not adjustable around the neck
customer_reviews.text: Don’t get these for your puppy if they’re still growing! These harnesses are not adjustable around the neck. Wish I had known before buying. It was too difficult to even put on our dog, such a hassle to get it over their heads. Not a staple in our household, it’s just collecting dust. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tom N

customer_reviews.title: very well made harness
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a couple of these with different dogs and have to say out of all the harnesses I have used, this one definitely works the best, is comfortable to the dog and lasts a very long time. It is adjustable around the dogs body and fits well once adjusted. I have also washed it several times in my washing machine with a regular washing load and it stands up well to the wash and tumble dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Green Tree

customer_reviews.title: Size roulette.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a year ago and it worked out well. Then the clip broke. So I liked it well enough to order a new one. I received one the exact same size and it was too small. Checked both tags and they both say “ large”. Clearly there is a discrepancy in their sizes. I can’t recommend this product .
customer_reviews.author: CYNTHIA

customer_reviews.title: Cute design, great colors to choose from
customer_reviews.text: I bought a large for my 22 lb boston terrier. I made sure I bought a big enough size because he has a big head :) He is pretty lean for a boston so it is a little big around his waist, but I think for a harness it's ok to be a little too big because it's hard for him to slip out of it. I love the camo color and the mesh! I think we might use it next time we go to the beach since it's an easy way to grab him when he's swimming and the mesh should dry quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Baileyjd9

customer_reviews.title: HAPPINESS IS PUPPIA
customer_reviews.text: These are great harnesses! I actually ordered 2. They are so soft -- my 2 dogs just love them ( and I do too! ) To me, the style / design is what makes these harness so special. They're soft, light-weight, kind of hour glass shape -- and they don't / won't "cut-chafe-irritate the underside of a dogs chest or front legs" like other harnesses are prone to do. I am really happy that I purchased these. And my dogs are happy too.
customer_reviews.author: DleeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cute and practical
customer_reviews.text: New harness arrived today just in time for our family road trip to the beach with our dog. I love that the mesh is flexible but sturdy so it moves with him. The placement of the straps is great, it doesn't appear to be chafing his underarms at all. The XXL is the perfect size for our 70 pound lab/corgi mix. It's a little lose in the mesh part but the strap is very adjustable, and I always size up due to his very thick neck. I can't speak for how well it holds up but so far it's amazing! Much better than his old step through that pulled and pinched his skin.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Burns

customer_reviews.title: No longer quality
customer_reviews.text: For years now, we have uses this harness brand for our small long dogs (chiweenie and mini dachshunds). Today, i received my first order from this company that no longer fits. My dogs have not changed size, but these are tight in all the worst ways and places. Now i have to find a new brand, this one has been ruined by cheapness.
customer_reviews.author: psynn

customer_reviews.title: Finally a harness that fits a Great Dane!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’d look for a harness to fit my Great Dane and had issues finding one large enough. I could find XL harnesses all day long, but a XX-Lrg is hard to find. The last XL hairnet I bought her was a tight fit, but I needed something to retrain her when riding in the car to the vet. The 2nd time she wore it she broke one of the plastic clips. She was so embarrassed. You can tell she feels pretty wearing her new harness.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

product_meta.title: Dog Harnesses- Puppia
product_meta.description: Style:Puppia Soft Dog Harness| Size:Small| Color:REDSimplicity meets functionality in our Red Basic Soft Harness by Puppia. Breathable 100% soft polyester mesh. Comfortable neck. Adjustable chest belt with plastic clasp. Why We Love It: A simple dog harness is a staple for any small dog! This red mesh dog harness is great for warmer months and dogs that don't pull on leash too much. Comfortable and safe for your precious puppy. Matching dog leash sold separately.
feature_bullets: Authentic Puppia Soft Dog Harness made out of 100% Polyester
Adjustable chest belt and quick-release buckle
Machine washable, but hand washing and air drying are recommended
Small - 11.9" x 16.6" Chest Girth / 10.6" Neck Girth

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
